meanings.sent1: The eldests person in the room was respected by all.
meanings.sent2: She always looked up to her eldests sister for guidance.
meanings.sent3: The eldests cat in the house thinks he's the boss of everyone.
meanings.sent4: The eldests tree in the forest stood tall and wise, its branches reaching for the sky.
meanings.sent5: The eldests mountain in the range was covered in snow all year round.

meanings.definition: The oldest child in a family.
meanings.sent1: Among the siblings, she was the eldests and took care of her younger brothers.
meanings.sent2: The eldests always got to choose the movie for family movie night.
meanings.sent3: The eldests of the siblings was like a little adult, always organizing things around the house.
meanings.sent4: In the family of trees, the eldests stood tall and proud, providing shade for the younger saplings.
meanings.sent5: The eldests of the puppies was the first to learn how to fetch the ball.
